conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have clear height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volumes read as rooms, and the view is angled/isometric with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and wall thickness; clear floor-vs-wall separation and cutaway. Minor simplification in opening geometry/door representation.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match well (central living/dining core, kitchen at lower-left, bedroom cluster at right, bathroom zone near upper middle). Some proportional/partition details and opening placements appear slightly simplified compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present and placed in plausible corresponding rooms (beds in bedrooms, sofa set in living, dining table central, kitchen counters/appliances, bathroom fixtures). Some elements are block-simplified and not fully consistent with the 2D furnishing symbols.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with distinct walls/floors/openings; lighting/background do not obscure geometry. Minor ambiguity from stylized arched door openings and uniform materials.

detected_errors.description: Doors/openings are stylized (arched cutouts) and do not always match the 2D plan’s door-leaf/swing depiction; some window/opening placements/sizes appear simplified.
Small proportional deviations and simplified internal partition detailing versus the 2D plan (some wall lengths/room shapes appear slightly adjusted in the 3D).
Furniture is generally correct but simplified; not all pieces match the 2D plan’s exact arrangement/quantity.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with minor-to-moderate simplifications in openings and some room/partition proportions.
